document.docAuthor: Abu El-Hassan, Gawhara M. M., Badrawy, Haitham B. M., Gad Allah, Sohair M., Soliman, Ahmed M., Salama, Mohamed S. & Mohammad, Salwa K.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of robber flies of the genus Stichopogon Loew (Diptera: Asilidae: Stichopogoninae) from Egypt

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of robber flies of the genus Stichopogon Loew (Diptera: Asilidae: Stichopogoninae) from Egypt

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality
. Egypt . (deposited in ZMHB : Humboldt Museum , Berlin , Germany )

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Length. Body 4.5̄ 6.5 mm , wing 2.9̄ 4.2 mm . Small pale yellowish-grey species; mystax white to yellow bristles; two basal antennal segments pale yellow, flagellum and style black; scutellum with a marginal row of long, erect hairs; femora blackish with yellow apex, tarsi and tibiae pale yellow to pale reddish-yellow, claws black with basal half reddish-yellow, pulvilli normal; cell m3 with relatively long stalk; abdomen grey, tergites with darker spots.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 A,B.
Stichopogon albellus Loew
(♀) habitus, body length = 5.8 mm.

FIGURE 4 A,B,C.
S. albellus
, habitus (♂) type.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Local distribution . Lower Nile Valley , Eastern Desert, Western Desert
,
Sinai , Fayoum.
